episodeTitle: A Raid! The Tin Tyrant and Tin Plate Wapol!
description: The Straw Hats encounter Wapol and his Bliking Pirates who attack the Going Merry. After Luffy defeats Wapol, the crew arrives at the snowy Drum Island seeking a doctor for the ill Nami, but faces hostility from the island's inhabitants.

events.title: Nami's Condition Worsens
events.description: Nami's illness continues to worsen as the crew searches for an island with a doctor. The crew keeps watch over her throughout the night, showing their concern for their navigator.
events.significance: Establishes the urgency of finding a doctor and sets up the crew's desperate need to reach Drum Island despite any obstacles.

events.title: Vivi Explains Island Climatic Types
events.description: As the crew notices the temperature dropping, Vivi explains the four types of island climates on the Grand Line: Spring, Summer, Autumn, and Winter islands, each with their own unique weather patterns.
events.significance: Provides important world-building information about how the Grand Line's unusual climate works and the different types of islands.

quotes.text: On the Grand Line, islands are classified into four climatic types.
quotes.speaker: Vivi
quotes.context: Explaining the Grand Line's climate system

events.title: The Bliking Emerges
events.description: A strange submarine-like ship called the Bliking emerges from beneath the ocean near the Going Merry. The ship is distinctively round with metal plating and a hippopotamus figurehead, marking the first submarine vessel seen in the series.
events.significance: Introduces the first submarine-capable ship in One Piece, showcasing the unique technology available in the Grand Line.

events.title: Wapol's Debut
events.description: Wapol, the former king of Drum Kingdom, makes his first appearance along with his subordinates Chess and Kuromarimo. He boards the Going Merry and immediately demonstrates his arrogant and gluttonous personality.
events.significance: Introduces the main antagonist of the Drum Island Arc, a former king turned pirate with a Devil Fruit that allows him to eat anything.

quotes.text: I am Wapol, the great king of the Drum Kingdom!
quotes.speaker: Wapol
quotes.context: Wapol's introduction to the Straw Hat crew

events.title: Baku Baku no Mi Debut
events.description: Wapol demonstrates his Baku Baku no Mi (Munch-Munch Fruit) Devil Fruit ability by opening his mouth impossibly wide and taking a massive bite out of the Going Merry's railing, eating the ship's wood.
events.significance: First appearance of the Baku Baku no Mi, a Paramecia-type Devil Fruit that allows the user to consume and assimilate anything into their body.

events.title: Luffy vs Wapol Begins
events.description: Enraged by Wapol eating his ship, Luffy immediately attacks Wapol and his crew. The Straw Hats fight against the Bliking Pirates to defend the Going Merry.
events.significance: First confrontation between Luffy and Wapol, establishing their antagonistic relationship.

quotes.text: You ate my ship! I'll never forgive you for that!
quotes.speaker: Luffy
quotes.context: Luffy's anger at Wapol for damaging the Going Merry

events.title: Wapol Eats Cannons
events.description: Wapol demonstrates another aspect of his Baku Baku no Mi ability by consuming cannons and incorporating them into his body, preparing to use them as weapons.
events.significance: Shows the versatility of the Baku Baku no Mi, revealing that Wapol can eat weapons and use them as part of his body.

events.title: Luffy Defeats Wapol
events.description: Luffy uses Gomu Gomu no Bazooka to send Wapol flying off the Going Merry and into the ocean, ending the battle decisively. Chess and Kuromarimo retreat with their ship to rescue their captain.
events.significance: First defeat of Wapol by Luffy, though not their final confrontation. Demonstrates Luffy's protective nature over his ship and crew.

events.title: Drum Island First Sighting
events.description: The Straw Hats spot Drum Island for the first time, a winter island covered in snow with distinctive rock formations that look like drums. The crew prepares to land despite the harsh weather.
events.significance: Introduction of Drum Island, the setting for a major arc that will introduce Tony Tony Chopper to the series.

events.title: Arrival at Drum Island's Shore
events.description: The Going Merry reaches the shore of Drum Island. The crew anchors near a river and prepares to disembark to search for a doctor for Nami.
events.significance: The crew reaches their destination, setting the stage for the events of the Drum Island Arc.

events.title: Dalton's Debut
events.description: Dalton, the former captain of the Drum Kingdom's Royal Guard, appears leading a group of armed villagers who confront the Straw Hats with hostility, ordering them to leave the island immediately.
events.significance: Introduces Dalton, who will become an important ally. His initial hostility reflects the island's traumatic history with pirates.

quotes.text: Raise your anchor and leave this island immediately! Pirates are not welcome here!
quotes.speaker: Dalton
quotes.context: Dalton's first words to the Straw Hats

events.title: Vivi Takes a Bullet
events.description: When a villager shoots at Sanji and misses, Sanji prepares to retaliate. Vivi throws herself in front of Sanji and takes a bullet in the arm to prevent the situation from escalating into violence, pleading for the crew to stay calm.
events.significance: Demonstrates Vivi's diplomatic wisdom and self-sacrifice. Her action prevents a battle that would have made it impossible to get help for Nami and shows her growth as a peacemaker.

quotes.text: Please, we're not here to fight! We just need a doctor!
quotes.speaker: Vivi

events.title: Drum Island's Tragic History Revealed
events.description: Dalton explains that Drum Island was invaded by pirates recently, causing the inhabitants to be deeply distrustful and hostile toward all pirates. He hints at the island's troubled past under Wapol's rule.
events.significance: Provides context for the villagers' hostility and begins to reveal the dark history of Drum Island under Wapol's tyranny.

events.title: Dalton Relents and Offers Help
events.description: Moved by Vivi's sacrifice and understanding the crew's desperate need for medical help, Dalton calls off the hostile villagers and agrees to guide the Straw Hats to the village of Bighorn.
events.significance: Dalton's compassion overcomes his distrust of pirates, beginning his friendship with the Straw Hats and allowing the arc to progress.

quotes.text: I can see you're not like the other pirates. Follow me to Bighorn.
quotes.speaker: Dalton
quotes.context: Dalton's decision to help the Straw Hats

events.title: Bighorn Village Introduction
events.description: The crew is led to Bighorn, one of the villages on Drum Island. Dalton takes them to his home to discuss their situation and the island's limited medical resources.
events.significance: Introduces Bighorn village as a location and sets up the revelation about Dr. Kureha being the island's only remaining doctor.

themes.description: Vivi's willingness to take a bullet to prevent violence demonstrates the power of self-sacrifice and compassion in changing hearts and minds.
themes.symbolism: Vivi's injury becomes a symbol of peaceful diplomacy and the willingness to endure pain for the greater good.

themes.description: Luffy's fierce reaction to Wapol damaging the Going Merry shows his deep attachment to his ship and his protective nature toward things he values.
themes.symbolism: The Going Merry represents the crew's home and dreams, making any attack on it a personal offense.

themes.description: The villagers' hostile reaction to pirates reflects their traumatic experiences, showing how past suffering can create deep-seated fear and prejudice.
themes.symbolism: Drum Island's cold, harsh climate mirrors the emotional coldness of its traumatized inhabitants.

mangaDifferences.difference: The anime shows more extended scenes of the crew watching over Nami during the night, adding emotional weight to her condition.
The anime condenses content from five different manga chapters (127, 128, 130, 131, 132) into a single episode, omitting Chapter 129 entirely.
Some pages from Chapters 127 and 128 were omitted or rearranged to improve the narrative flow in the anime.

trivia.fact: This episode marks Akemi Okamura's permanent return to voicing Nami after taking maternity leave for the previous nine episodes (70-78).
The Bliking is the first submarine-capable ship shown in the One Piece series, predating more advanced submarines seen later.
The name 'Bliking' is a pun combining 'Blik' (Dutch for 'tin plated') and 'king', reflecting Wapol's title as the tin-plate king.
This is one of the few times the Going Merry is actually eaten, with Wapol taking a massive bite out of the ship's railing that Usopp has to repair.
